brooklyn.entity.nosql.cassandra
[Java] Class CassandraDatacenterImpl.SeedTracker

java.lang.Object
  brooklyn.entity.nosql.cassandra.CassandraDatacenterImpl.SeedTracker

protected class CassandraDatacenterImpl.SeedTracker

For tracking our seeds. This gets fiddly! High-level logic is:

  • If we have never reached quorum (i.e. have never published seeds), then continue to wait for quorum; because entity-startup may be blocking for this. This is handled by the seedSupplier.
  • If we previously reached quorum (i.e. have previousy published seeds), then always update; we never want stale/dead entities listed in our seeds.
  • If an existing seed looks unhealthy, then replace it.
  • If a new potential seed becomes available (and we're in need of more), then add it.
      Also note that CassandraFabric can take over, because it know about multiple sub-clusters! It will provide a different CassandraDatacenter#SEED_SUPPLIER#SEED_SUPPLIER. Each time we think that our seeds need to change, we call that. The fabric will call into CassandraDatacenterImpl#gatherPotentialSeeds()#gatherPotentialSeeds() to find out what's available.
      Authors:
      aled
